definition: reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: Bacon still remains one of the top movie stars in Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 而貝肯仍舊是好萊塢數一數二的電影明星。

sentences.english: Laboratory building in the intensity of investment in Hebei enterprises in one of veterinary drugs.
sentences.chinese: 實驗室的建設投入的力度在河北獸藥企業中數一數二。

sentences.english: Captain Aizen's ability has ranked among the top of all captains.
sentences.chinese: 藍染隊長的能力在隊長當中數一數二。

sentences.english: Pettersson is heading the project for one of Sweden's largest property owners.
sentences.chinese: 彼得森正在領導這個瑞典數一數二的地產業主專案。

sentences.english: The beaches in Thailand are some of the best in the world.
sentences.chinese: 泰國的海灘也是世界上數一數二的。

sentences.english: The orbits of these moons are some of the most complicated in the solar system.
sentences.chinese: 這些衛星軌道的複雜度在太陽系當中算是數一數二的。

sentences.english: Of all Dezaou roasted chickens, only that Family Ma made in old Dexiang store is authentically original.
sentences.chinese: 咱們德州扒雞，老德祥馬家的是數一數二的正宗。

sentences.english: Thai food is regularly rated as some of the best in the world.
sentences.chinese: 泰式料理通常被列爲世界上數一數二的美食。

sentences.english: Both are the same power level in one of the vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 兩者的動力都是同級別車中數一數二的。

sentences.english: He is at the top of his class.
sentences.chinese: 他是班上數一數二的好學生。

definition: can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
peak/apex/world best/number one/finest (competitors)/top (figures in a certain field)
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
